properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) Account name. This can be used for logging in to CloudN console or UserConnect controller.

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider. Only AWS, GCP, ARM and OCI are supported currently. Enter 1 for AWS, 4 for GCP, 8 for ARM, 16 for OCI.

properties.name: aws_account_number
properties.description: (Optional) AWS Account number to associate with Aviatrix account. Required when creating an account for AWS.

properties.name: aws_iam
properties.description: (Optional) AWS IAM-role based flag, this option is for UserConnect.

properties.name: aws_access_key
properties.description: (Optional) AWS Access Key. Required when aws_iam is "false" and when creating an account for AWS.

properties.name: aws_secret_key
properties.description: (Optional) AWS Secret Key. Required when aws_iam is "false" and when creating an account for AWS.

properties.name: aws_role_app
properties.description: (Optional) AWS App role ARN, this option is for UserConnect. Required when aws_iam is "true" and when creating an account for AWS.

properties.name: aws_role_ec2
properties.description: (Optional) AWS EC2 role ARN, this option is for UserConnect. Required when aws_iam is "true" and when creating an account for AWS.

properties.name: gcloud_project_id
properties.description: (Optional) GCloud Project ID.

properties.name: gcloud_project_credentials_filepath
properties.description: (Optional) GCloud Project Credentials [local filepath].json. Required when creating an account for GCP.

properties.name: arm_subscription_id
properties.description: (Optional) Azure ARM Subscription ID. Required when creating an account for ARM.

properties.name: arm_directory_id
properties.description: (Optional) Azure ARM Directory ID. Required when creating an account for ARM.

properties.name: arm_application_id
properties.description: (Optional) Azure ARM Application ID. Required when creating an account for ARM.

properties.name: arm_application_key
properties.description: (Optional) Azure ARM Application key. Required when creating an account for ARM.

properties.name: oci_tenancy_id
properties.description: (Optional)Oracle OCI Tenancy ID. Required when creating an account for OCI.

properties.name: oci_user_id
properties.description: (Optional) Oracle OCI User ID. Required when creating an account for OCI.

properties.name: oci_compartment_id
properties.description: (Optional) Oracle OCI Compartment ID. Required when creating an account for OCI.

properties.name: oci_api_private_key_filepath
properties.description: (Optional) Oracle OCI API Private Key local file path. Required when creating an account for OCI.

NOTE: Please make sure that the IAM roles/profiles have already been created before running this, if aws_iam = "true". More information on the IAM roles is at https://docs.aviatrix.com/HowTos/iam_policies.html and https://docs.aviatrix.com/HowTos/HowTo_IAM_role.html
The following arguments are supported for creating user account:

properties.name: username
properties.description: (Required) Name of account user to be created.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) Cloud account name of user to be created.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) Email of address of account user to be created.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Required) Login password for the account user to be created. If password is changed, current account will be destroyed and a new account will be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account_name1
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of an Azure Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: account_name2
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of an Azure Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: vnet_name_resource_group1
properties.description: (Required) VNet-Name of Azure cloud. Example: "VNet_Name:Resource_Group_Name".

properties.name: vnet_name_resource_group2
properties.description: (Required) VNet-Name of Azure cloud. Example: "VNet_Name:Resource_Group_Name".

properties.name: vnet_reg1
properties.description: (Required) Region of Azure cloud. Example: "East US 2".

properties.name: vnet_reg2
properties.description: (Required) Region of Azure cloud. Example: "East US 2".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account_name1
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of an AWS Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: account_name2
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of an AWS Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: vpc_id1
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID of AWS cloud. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234".

properties.name: vpc_id2
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID of AWS cloud. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234".

properties.name: vpc_reg1
properties.description: (Required) Region of AWS cloud. Example: AWS: "us-east-1".

properties.name: vpc_reg2
properties.description: (Required) Region of AWS cloud. Example: AWS: "us-east-1".

properties.name: rtb_list1
properties.description: (Optional) List of Route table ID. Valid Values: ["all"], ["rtb-abcd1234"] OR ["rtb-abcd1234,rtb-wxyz5678"].

properties.name: rtb_list2
properties.description: (Optional) List of Route table ID. Valid Values: ["all"], ["rtb-abcd1234"] OR ["rtb-abcd1234,rtb-wxyz5678"].
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: tgw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the AWS TGW which is going to be created.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider(AWS).

properties.name: aws_side_as_number
properties.description: (Required) BGP Local ASN (Autonomous System Number). Integer between 1-65535. Example: "65001".

properties.name: list description
security_domain_name
properties.description: (Required) Three default domains ("Aviatrix_Edge_Domain", "Default_Domain" and "Shared_Service_Domain") are required with AWS TGW's creation.

properties.name: aviatrix_firewall
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if the security domain is an aviatrix firewall domain. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: native_egress
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if the security domain is a native egress domain. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: native_firewall
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if the security domain is a native firewall domain. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: connected_domains
properties.description: (Optional) A list of domains connected to the domain (name: security_domain_name) together with its creation.

properties.name: attached_vpc
properties.description: (Optional) A list of VPCs attached to the domain (name: security_domain_name) together with its creation. This list needs to be null for "Aviatrix_Edge_Domain".

properties.name: vpc_region
properties.description: (Required) Region of the vpc, needs to be consistent with AWS TGW's region.

properties.name: vpc_account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the ID of the VPC which is going to be attached to the security domain (name: security_domain_name) which is going to be created.

properties.name: attached_aviatrix_transit_gateway
properties.description: (Optional) A list of Names of Aviatrix Transit Gateway to attach to one of the three default domains: Aviatrix_Edge_Domain.

properties.name: manage_vpc_attachment
properties.description: (Optional) This parameter is a switch used to allow attaching VPCs to tgw using the aviatrix_aws_tgw resource. If it is set to false, attachment of vpc must be done using the aviatrix_aws_tgw_vpc_attachment resource. Valid values: true or false. Default value is true.

NOTE: manage_vpc_attachment - If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R1.5+, and an aws_tgw resource was originally created with a provider version <R1.5, you must do ‘terraform refresh’ to update and apply the attribute’s default value (true) into the state file.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: tgw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the AWS TGW.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider(AWS).

properties.name: security_domain_name
properties.description: (Required & ForceNew) The name of the security domain, to which the VPC will be attached. If changed, the VPC will be detached from the old domain, and attached to the new domain.

properties.name: vpc_account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller, which is associated with the VPC.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the ID of the VPC which is going to be attached to the security domain (name: security_domain_name).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: tgw_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of an AWS TGW.

properties.name: route_domain_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of a route domain, to which the vpn will be attached. Only "Default_Domain" is supported now.

properties.name: connection_name
properties.description: (Required) Unique name of the connection.

properties.name: public_ip
properties.description: (Required) Public IP address. Example: "40.0.0.0".

properties.name: remote_as_number
properties.description: (Optional) AWS side as a number. Integer between 1-65535. Example: "12".

properties.name: remote_cidr
properties.description: (Optional) Remote CIDRs separated by ",". Example: AWS: "16.0.0.0/16,16.1.0.0/16".

properties.name: inside_ip_cidr_tun_1
properties.description: (Optional) Inside IP CIDR for Tunnel 1. A /30 CIDR in 169.254.0.0/16.

properties.name: pre_shared_key_tun_1
properties.description: (Optional) Pre-Shared Key for Tunnel 1. A 8-64 character string with alphanumeric underscore(_) and dot(.). It cannot start with 0.

properties.name: inside_ip_cidr_tun_2
properties.description: (Optional) Inside IP CIDR for Tunnel 2. A /30 CIDR in 169.254.0.0/16.

properties.name: pre_shared_key_tun_2
properties.description: (Optional) Pre-Shared Key for Tunnel 2. A 8-64 character string with alphanumeric underscore(_) and dot(.). It cannot start with 0.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: sg_management_account_name
properties.description: (Optional) Cloud account name of user.

properties.name: http_access
properties.description: (Optional) Switch for http access. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: fqdn_exception_rule
properties.description: (Optional) A system-wide mode. Valida values: true, false. Defaultvalue: true.

properties.name: security_group_management
properties.description: (Optional) Used to manage the Controller instance’s inbound rules from gateways. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: target_version
properties.description: (Optional) The release version number to which the controller will be upgraded to. If not specified, controller will not be upgraded. If set to "latest", controller will be upgraded to the latest release. Please look at https://docs.aviatrix.com/HowTos/inline_upgrade.html for more information.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the Security VPC.

properties.name: inspection_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable/Disable traffic inspection. Valid values: true, false. Default value: true.

properties.name: egress_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable/Disable egress through firewall. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: list description
firenet_gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the primary FireNet gateway.

properties.name: vendor_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of the firewall. Valid values: "Generic", "fqdn_gateway". Default value: "Generic".

properties.name: instance_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of Firewall instance, if associating FQDN gateway to fireNet, it is FQDN gateway's gw_name..

properties.name: firewall_name
properties.description: (Optional) Firewall instance name, required if it is a firewall instance.

properties.name: lan_interface
properties.description: - (Optional) Lan interface ID, required if it is a firewall instance.

properties.name: management_interface
properties.description: (Optional) Management interface ID, required if it is a firewall instance.

properties.name: egress_interface
properties.description: - (Optional) Egress interface ID, required if it is a firewall instance.

properties.name: attached
properties.description: - (Optional) Switch to attach/detach firewall instance to/from fireNet. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.
NOTE: inspection_enabled - Default value is true for associating firewall instance to fireNet. Only false is supported for associating FQDN gateway to fireNet.
NOTE: egress_enabled - Default value is false for associating firewall instance to fireNet. Only true is supported for associating FQDN gateway to fireNet.
NOTE: firewall_instance_association - If associating FQDN gateway to fireNet, "single_az_ha" needs to be enabled for the FQDN gateway.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of gateway.

properties.name: base_policy
properties.description: (Optional) New base policy. Valid Values: "allow-all", "deny-all".

properties.name: base_log_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether enable logging or not. Valid Values: true, false.

properties.name: list description
src_ip
properties.description: (Required) CIDRs separated by comma or tag names such "HR" or "marketing" etc. Example: "10.30.0.0/16,10.45.0.0/20". The aviatrix_firewall_tag resource should be created prior to using the tag name.

properties.name: dst_ip
properties.description: (Required) CIDRs separated by comma or tag names such "HR" or "marketing" etc. Example: "10.30.0.0/16,10.45.0.0/20". The aviatrix_firewall_tag resource should be created prior to using the tag name.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: - (Optional): "all", "tcp", "udp", "icmp", "sctp", "rdp", "dccp".

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) a single port or a range of port numbers. Example: "25", "25:1024".

properties.name: action
properties.description: - (Required) Valid values: "allow", "deny".

properties.name: log_enabled
properties.description: - (Optional) Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: description
properties.description: - (Optional) Description of the policy. Example: "This is policy no.1".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the Security VPC.

properties.name: firenet_gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the primary FireNet gateway.

properties.name: firewall_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the firewall instance to be created.

properties.name: firewall_image
properties.description: (Required) One of the AWS AMIs from Palo Alto Networks.

properties.name: firewall_size
properties.description: (Required) Instance size of the firewall. Example: "m5.xlarge".

properties.name: management_subnet
properties.description: (Required) Management Interface Subnet. Select the subnet whose name contains “gateway and firewall management”.

properties.name: egress_subnet
properties.description: (Required) Egress Interface Subnet. Select the subnet whose name contains “FW-ingress-egress”.

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: - (Optional) The .pem file name for SSH access to the firewall instance.

properties.name: iam_role
properties.description: (Optional) In advanced mode, create an IAM Role on the AWS account that launched the FireNet gateway. Create a policy to attach to the role. The policy is to allow access to “Bootstrap Bucket”.

properties.name: bootstrap_bucket_name
properties.description: - (Optional) In advanced mode, specify a bootstrap bucket name where the initial configuration and policy file is stored.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: firewall_tag
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: list description
cidr_tag_name
properties.description: (Required) The name attribute of a policy. Example: "policy1".

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: (Required) The CIDR attribute of a policy. Example: "10.88.88.88/32".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: fqdn_tag
properties.description: (Required) FQDN Filter Tag Name.

properties.name: fqdn_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) FQDN Filter Tag Status. Valid values: true, false.

properties.name: fqdn_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Specify the tag color to be a white-list tag or black-list tag. Valid values: "white", "black".

properties.name: list description
gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the gateway to attach to the specific tag.

properties.name: source_ip_list
properties.description: (Optional) List of source IPs in the VPC qualified for a specific tag.

properties.name: list description
fqdn
properties.description: (Required) FQDN. Example: "facebook.com".

properties.name: proto
properties.description: (Required) Protocol. Valid values: "all", "tcp", "udp", "icmp".

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) Port. Example "25".

properties.name: For protocol "all", port must be set to "all".
properties.description: • For protocol "all", port must be set to "all".

properties.name: For protocol “icmp”, port must be set to “ping”.
properties.description: • For protocol “icmp”, port must be set to “ping”.

NOTE: If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R1.5+, and an fqdn resource was originally created with a provider version <R1.5, you must modify your configuration file to match current format, and do ‘terraform refresh’ to update the state file to current format.

NOTE: In order for the FQDN feature to be enabled, “enable_snat” must be set to true in the specified gateway. If it is not set at gateway creation, creation of FQDN resource will automatically enable SNAT and users must rectify the diff in the Terraform state by setting "enable_nat = true"in their gateway resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider, requires an integer value. Currently only AWS(1), GCP(4), ARM(8), and OCI(16) are supported.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) Account name. This account will be used to launch Aviatrix gateway.

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Aviatrix gateway unique name.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID/VNet-Name of cloud provider. Required if for aws. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234", GCP: "vpc-gcp-test", ARM: "vnet1:hello", OCI: "vpc-oracle-test1".

properties.name: vpc_reg
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider. Example: AWS: "us-east-1", GCP: "us-west2-a", ARM: "East US 2", Oracle: "us-ashburn-1".

properties.name: gw_size
properties.description: (Required) Size of the gateway instance. Example: AWS: "t2.large", ARM: "Standard_B1s", Oracle: "VM.Standard2.2", GCP: "n1-standard-1".

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Required) A VPC Network address range selected from one of the available network ranges. Example: "172.31.0.0/20".

properties.name: insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Gateway. Required for AWS if insane_mode is set. Example: AWS: "us-west-1a".

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: (Optional) Enable Source NAT for this container. Supported values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: vpn_access
properties.description: (Optional) Enable user access through VPN to this container. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: vpn_cidr
properties.description: (Optional) VPN CIDR block for the container. Required if vpn_access is true. Example: "192.168.43.0/24".

properties.name: max_vpn_conn
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum number of active VPN users allowed to be connected to this gateway. Required if vpn_access is true. Make sure the number is smaller than the VPN CIDR block. Example: 100.

properties.name: enable_elb
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether to enable ELB or not. Not supported for Oracle gateways. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: elb_name
properties.description: (Optional) A name for the ELB that is created. If it is not specified, a name is generated automatically.

properties.name: split_tunnel
properties.description: (Optional) Specify split tunnel mode. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: name_servers
properties.description: (Optional) A list of DNS servers used to resolve domain names by a connected VPN user when Split Tunnel Mode is enabled.

properties.name: search_domains
properties.description: (Optional) A list of domain names that will use the NameServer when a specific name is not in the destination when Split Tunnel Mode is enabled.

properties.name: additional_cidrs
properties.description: (Optional) A list of destination CIDR ranges that will also go through the VPN tunnel when Split Tunnel Mode is enabled.

properties.name: otp_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Two step authentication mode. "2": DUO, "3": Okta.

properties.name: saml_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) This field indicates whether enabling SAML or not. This field is available in controller version 3.3 or later release. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: okta_token
properties.description: (Optional) Token for Okta auth mode. Required if otp_mode is "3".

properties.name: okta_url
properties.description: (Optional) URL for Okta auth mode. Required if otp_mode is "3".

properties.name: okta_username_suffix
properties.description: (Optional) Username suffix for Okta auth mode. Example: "aviatrix.com".

properties.name: duo_integration_key
properties.description: (Optional) Integration key for DUO auth mode. Required if otp_mode is "2".

properties.name: duo_secret_key
properties.description: (Optional) Secret key for DUO auth mode. Required if otp_mode is "2".

properties.name: duo_api_hostname
properties.description: (Optional) API hostname for DUO auth mode. Required: Yes if otp_mode is "2".

properties.name: duo_push_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Push mode for DUO auth. Required if otp_mode is "2". Valid values: "auto", "selective" and "token".

properties.name: enable_ldap
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether to enable LDAP or not. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: ldap_server
properties.description: (Optional) LDAP server address. Required if enable_ldap is true.

properties.name: ldap_bind_dn
properties.description: (Optional) LDAP bind DN. Required if enable_ldap is true.

properties.name: ldap_password
properties.description: (Optional) LDAP password. Required if enable_ldap is true.

properties.name: ldap_base_dn
properties.description: (Optional) LDAP base DN. Required if enable_ldap is true.

properties.name: ldap_username_attribute
properties.description: (Optional) LDAP user attribute. Required if enable_ldap is true.

properties.name: peering_ha_subnet
properties.description: (Optional) Public Subnet Information while creating Peering HA Gateway, only subnet is accepted. Required for AWS/ARM if enabling Peering HA. Example: AWS: "10.0.0.0/16".

properties.name: peering_ha_zone
properties.description: (Optional) Zone information for creating Peering HA Gateway, only zone is accepted. Required for GCP if enabling Peering HA. Example: GCP: "us-west1-c".

properties.name: peering_ha_insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Peering HA Gateway. Required for AWS if insane_mode is set and peering_ha_subnet is set. Example: AWS: "us-west-1a".

properties.name: peering_ha_eip
properties.description: (Optional) Public IP address that you want assigned to the HA peering instance. Only available for AWS.

properties.name: peering_ha_gw_size
properties.description: (Optional) Size of the Peering HA Gateway.

properties.name: single_az_ha
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if this feature is desired. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: allocate_new_eip
properties.description: (Optional) When value is false, reuse an idle address in Elastic IP pool for this gateway. Otherwise, allocate a new Elastic IP and use it for this gateway. Available in controller 2.7 or later release. Supported values: true, false. Default: true. Option not available for GCP, ARM and Oracle gateways, they will automatically allocate new eip's.

properties.name: eip
properties.description: (Optional) Required when allocate_new_eip is false. It uses specified EIP for this gateway. Available in controller 3.5 or later release. Only available for AWS.

properties.name: tag_list
properties.description: (Optional) Instance tag of cloud provider. Only available for AWS. Example: ["key1:value1", "key2:value2"].

properties.name: insane_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Enable Insane Mode for Gateway. Insane Mode Gateway size must be at least c5 (AWS) or Standard_D3_v2 (ARM). If set, will look for spare /26 segment to create a new subnet. Only supported for AWS or ARM. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: enable_vpc_dns_server
properties.description: (Optional) Enable VPC DNS Server for Gateway. Currently only supports AWS. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: endpoint_name
properties.description: (Required) The SAML Endpoint name.

properties.name: idp_metadata_type
properties.description: (Required) The IDP Metadata type. At the moment only "Text" is supported.

properties.name: idp_metadata
properties.description: (Required) The IDP Metadata from SAML provider. Normally the metadata is in XML format which may contain special characters. Best practice is encode metadata in base64 and set here ${base64decode(var.idp_metadata)}.

properties.name: custom_entity_id
properties.description: (Required) Custom Entity ID. Required to be non-empty for 'Custom' Entity ID type, empty for 'Hostname' Entity ID type.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: primary_cloud_gateway_name
properties.description: (Required) Primary Cloud Gateway Name.

properties.name: backup_gateway_name
properties.description: (Optional) Backup gateway name.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC Id of the cloud gateway.

properties.name: connection_name
properties.description: (Required) Site2Cloud Connection Name.

properties.name: connection_type
properties.description: (Required) Connection Type. Valid Values: "mapped", "unmapped".

properties.name: tunnel_type
properties.description: (Required) Site2Cloud Tunnel Type. Valid Values: "udp", "tcp".

properties.name: remote_gateway_type
properties.description: (Required) Remote Gateway Type. Valid Values: "generic", "avx", "aws", "azure", "sonicwall", "oracle".

properties.name: remote_gateway_ip
properties.description: (Required) Remote Gateway IP.

properties.name: backup_remote_gateway_ip
properties.description: (Optional) Backup Remote Gateway IP.

properties.name: pre_shared_key
properties.description: (Optional) Pre-Shared Key.

properties.name: backup_pre_shared_key
properties.description: (Optional) Backup Pre-Shared Key.

properties.name: remote_subnet_cidr
properties.description: (Required) Remote Subnet CIDR.

properties.name: local_subnet_cidr
properties.description: (Optional) Local Subnet CIDR. Required for connection type "mapped".

properties.name: remote_subnet_virtual
properties.description: Remote Subnet CIDR (Virtual). Required for connection type "mapped" only.

properties.name: local_subnet_virtual
properties.description: Local Subnet CIDR (Virtual). Required for connection type "mapped" only.

properties.name: ha_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether enabling HA or not. Valid Values: true, false.

properties.name: custom_algorithms
properties.description: (Optional) Switch to enable custom/non-default algorithms for IPSec Authentication/Encryption. Valid values: true, false.

properties.name: phase_1_authentication
properties.description: (Optional) Phase one Authentication. Valid values: 'SHA-1', 'SHA-256', 'SHA-384' and 'SHA-512'. Default value: 'SHA-1'.

properties.name: phase_2_authentication
properties.description: (Optional) Phase two Authentication. Valid values: 'NO-AUTH', 'HMAC-SHA-1', 'HMAC-SHA-256', 'HMAC-SHA-384' and 'HMAC-SHA-512'. Default value: 'HMAC-SHA-1'.

properties.name: phase_1_dh_groups
properties.description: (Optional) Phase one DH Groups. Valid values: '1', '2', '5', '14', '15', '16', '17' and '18'. Default value: '2'.

properties.name: phase_2_dh_groups
properties.description: (Optional) Phase two DH Groups. Valid values: '1', '2', '5', '14', '15', '16', '17' and '18'. Default value: '2'.

properties.name: phase_1_encryption
properties.description: (Optional) Phase one Encryption. Valid values: '3DES', 'AES-128-CBC', 'AES-192-CBC' and 'AES-256-CBC'. Default value: 'AES-256-CBC'.

properties.name: phase_2_encryption
properties.description: (Optional) Phase two Encryption. Valid values: '3DES', 'AES-128-CBC', 'AES-192-CBC', 'AES-256-CBC', 'AES-128-GCM-64', 'AES-128-GCM-96' and 'AES-128-GCM-128'. Default value: 'AES-256-CBC'.

properties.name: private_route_encryption
properties.description: (Optional) Private route encryption switch. Valid values: true, false.

properties.name: route_table_list
properties.description: (Optional) Route tables to modify.

properties.name: remote_gateway_latitude
properties.description: (Optional) Latitude of remote gateway. Does not support refresh.

properties.name: remote_gateway_longitude
properties.description: (Optional) Longitude of remote gateway. Does not support refresh.

properties.name: backup_remote_gateway_latitude
properties.description: (Optional) Latitude of backup remote gateway. Does not support refresh.

properties.name: backup_remote_gateway_longitude
properties.description: (Optional) Longitude of backup remote gateway. Does not support refresh.

properties.name: ssl_server_pool
properties.description: (Optional) Specify ssl_server_pool for tunnel_type "tcp". Default value: "192.168.44.0/24".

properties.name: enable_dead_peer_detection
properties.description: (Optional) Switch to Enable/Disable Deed Peer Detection for an existing site2cloud connection. Default value: true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider. AWS=1, GCP=4, ARM=8.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the gateway which is going to be created.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID/VNet-Name of cloud provider. Required if cloud_type is "1" or "4". Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234", etc...

properties.name: vpc_reg
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider. Example: AWS: "us-east-1", GCP: "us-west1-b", ARM: "East US 2", etc...

properties.name: vpc_size
properties.description: (Required) Size of the gateway instance. Example: AWS: "t2.large", GCP: "f1.micro", ARM: "StandardD2", etc...

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Required) Public Subnet Info. Example: AWS: "CIDRZONESubnetName", etc...

properties.name: ha_subnet
properties.description: (Optional) HA Subnet. Required for enabling HA for AWS/ARM gateways. Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid subnet (Example: 10.12.0.0/24) will create an HA gateway on the subnet.

properties.name: ha_zone
properties.description: (Optional) HA Zone. Required for enabling HA for GCP gateway. Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid zone will create an HA gateway in the zone. Example: "us-west1-c".

properties.name: ha_gw_size
properties.description: (Optional) HA Gateway Size. Mandatory if HA is enabled (ha_subnet is set). Example: "t2.micro".

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: (Optional) Enable Source NAT for this container. Supported values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: single_az_ha
properties.description: (Optional) Set to "enabled" if this feature is desired.

properties.name: transit_gw
properties.description: (Optional) Specify the transit Gateway.

properties.name: tag_list
properties.description: (Optional) Instance tag of cloud provider. Example: key1:value1,key002:value002, etc... Only AWS (cloud_type is "1") is supported
The following arguments are deprecated:

properties.name: dns_server
properties.description: Specify the DNS IP, only required while using a custom private DNS for the VPC.

NOTE: vnet_and_resource_group_names - If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R1.10+, and an ARM spoke_vpc resource was originally created with a provider version < R1.10, you must replace "vnet_and_resource_group_names" with "vpc_id" in your configuration file, and do ‘terraform refresh’ to set its value to "vpc_id" and apply it into the state file.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider, requires an integer value. Currently only AWS(1), GCP(4), ARM(8), and OCI(16) are supported.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the gateway which is going to be created.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID/VNet-Name of cloud provider. Required if for aws. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234", GCP: "vpc-gcp-test", ARM: "vnet1:hello", OCI: "vpc-oracle-test1".

properties.name: vpc_reg
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider. Example: AWS: "us-east-1", GCP: "us-west2-a", ARM: "East US 2", Oracle: "us-ashburn-1".

properties.name: gw_size
properties.description: (Required) Size of the gateway instance. Example: AWS: "t2.large", ARM: "Standard_B1s", Oracle: "VM.Standard2.2", GCP: "n1-standard-1".

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Required) A VPC Network address range selected from one of the available network ranges. Example: "172.31.0.0/20".

properties.name: insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Required) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Spoke Gateway. Required for AWS if insane_mode is enabled. Example: AWS: "us-west-1a".

properties.name: allocate_new_eip
properties.description: (Optional) When value is false, reuse an idle address in Elastic IP pool for this gateway. Otherwise, allocate a new Elastic IP and use it for this gateway. Available in controller 4.7 or later release. Supported values: true, false. Default: true. Option not available for GCP, ARM and Oracle gateways, they will automatically allocate new eip's.

properties.name: eip
properties.description: (Optional) Required when allocate_new_eip is false. It uses specified EIP for this gateway. Available in controller 4.7 or later release.

properties.name: ha_subnet
properties.description: (Optional) HA Subnet. Required for enabling HA for AWS/ARM gateway. Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid subnet CIDR will create an HA gateway on the subnet. Example: "10.12.0.0/24"

properties.name: ha_zone
properties.description: (Optional) HA Zone. Required for enabling HA for GCP gateway. Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid zone will create an HA gateway in the zone. Example: "us-west1-c".

properties.name: ha_insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Spoke HA Gateway. Required for AWS if insane_mode is enabled and ha_subnet is set. Example: AWS: "us-west-1a".

properties.name: ha_gw_size
properties.description: (Optional) HA Gateway Size. Mandatory if HA is enabled (ha_subnet is set). Example: "t2.micro".

properties.name: ha_eip
properties.description: (Optional) Public IP address that you want to assign to the HA peering instance. If no value is given, a new eip will automatically allocated. Only available for AWS.

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether enabling Source NAT feature on the gateway or not. Please disable AWS NAT instance before enabling this feature. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: single_az_ha
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if this feature is desired. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: transit_gw
properties.description: (Optional) Specify the transit Gateway.

properties.name: tag_list
properties.description: (Optional) Instance tag of cloud provider. Only AWS, cloud_type is "1", is supported. Example: ["key1:value1", "key2:value2"].

properties.name: insane_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Enable Insane Mode for Spoke Gateway. Insane Mode gateway size has to be at least c5 (AWS) or Standard_D3_v2 (ARM). If enabled, will look for spare /26 segment to create a new subnet. Only supported for AWS and ARM. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: enable_active_mesh
properties.description: (Optional) Switch to Enable/Disable Active Mesh Mode for Spoke Gateway. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: enable_vpc_dns_server
properties.description: (Optional) Enable VPC DNS Server for Gateway. Currently only supports AWS. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider, requires an integer value. Currently only AWS(1), GCP(4), ARM(8), and OCI(16) are supported.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the gateway which is going to be created.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID/VNet-Name of cloud provider. Required if for aws. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234", GCP: "vpc-gcp-test".

properties.name: vpc_reg
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider. Example: AWS: "us-east-1", ARM: "East US 2", Oracle: "us-ashburn-1", GCP: "us-west2-a".

properties.name: gw_size
properties.description: (Required) Size of the gateway instance. Example: AWS: "t2.large", ARM: "Standard_B1s", Oracle: "VM.Standard2.2", GCP: "n1-standard-1".

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Required) A VPC Network address range selected from one of the available network ranges. Example: "172.31.0.0/20".

properties.name: allocate_new_eip
properties.description: (Optional) When value is false, reuse an idle address in Elastic IP pool for this gateway. Otherwise, allocate a new Elastic IP and use it for this gateway. Available in controller 4.7 or later release. Supported values: true, false. Default: true. Option not available for GCP, ARM and Oracle gateways, they will automatically allocate new eip's.

properties.name: eip
properties.description: (Optional) Required when allocate_new_eip is false. It uses specified EIP for this gateway. Available in controller 4.7 or later release.

properties.name: ha_subnet
properties.description: (Optional) HA Subnet CIDR. Required for enabling HA for AWS/ARM gateway. Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid subnet CIDR will create an HA gateway on the subnet. Example: "10.12.0.0/24".

properties.name: ha_zone
properties.description: (Optional) HA Zone. Required for enabling HA for GCP gateway. Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid zone will create an HA gateway in the zone. Example: "us-west1-c".

properties.name: ha_gw_size
properties.description: (Optional) HA Gateway Size. Mandatory if HA is enabled (ha_subnet is set). Example: "t2.micro".

properties.name: ha_eip
properties.description: (Optional) Public IP address that you want to assign to the HA peering instance. If no value is given, a new eip will automatically allocated. Only available for AWS.

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: (Optional) Enable Source NAT for this container. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: single_az_ha
properties.description: (Optional) Set to true if this feature is desired. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: tag_list
properties.description: (Optional) Instance tag of cloud provider. Only supported for AWS. Example: ["key1:value1","key2:value2"].

properties.name: enable_hybrid_connection
properties.description: (Optional) Sign of readiness for TGW connection. Only supported for AWS. Example: false.

properties.name: enable_firenet
properties.description: (Optional) Sign of readiness for FireNet connection. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: connected_transit
properties.description: (Optional) Specify Connected Transit status. If enabled, it allows spokes to run traffics to other spokes via transit gateway. Supported values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: insane_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Specify Insane Mode high performance gateway. Insane Mode gateway size must be at least c5 size (AWS) or Standard_D3_v2 (ARM). If enabled, will look for spare /26 segment to create a new subnet. Only available for AWS and ARM. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Transit Gateway. Required for AWS if insane_mode is enabled. Example: AWS: "us-west-1a".

properties.name: ha_insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Transit HA Gateway. Required for AWS if insane_mode is enabled and ha_subnet is set. Example: AWS: "us-west-1a".

properties.name: enable_active_mesh
properties.description: (Optional) Switch to Enable/Disable Active Mesh Mode for Transit Gateway. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: enable_vpc_dns_server
properties.description: (Optional) Enable VPC DNS Server for Gateway. Currently only supports AWS. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: enable_advertise_transit_cidr
properties.description: (Optional) Switch to Enable/Disable advertise transit VPC network CIDR for a vgw connection. Available as of R2.6.

properties.name: bgp_manual_spoke_advertise_cidrs
properties.description: (Optional) Intended CIDR list to advertise to VGW. Example: "10.2.0.0/16,10.4.0.0/16". Available as of R2.6.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: transit_gateway_name1
properties.description: (Required) The first transit gateway name to make a peer pair.

properties.name: transit_gateway_name2
properties.description: (Required) The second transit gateway name to make a peer pair.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider, requires an integer value. Use 1 for AWS.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the gateway which is going to be created.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID/VNet-Name of cloud provider. Required if for aws. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234", GCP: "mygooglecloudvpcname", etc...

properties.name: vpc_reg
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider. Example: AWS: "us-east-1", ARM: "East US 2", etc...

properties.name: vpc_size
properties.description: (Required) Size of the gateway instance. Example: AWS: "t2.large", etc...

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: (Required) Public Subnet CIDR. Example: AWS: "10.0.0.0/24". Copy/paste from AWS Console to get the right subnet CIDR.

properties.name: ha_subnet
properties.description: (Optional) HA Subnet CIDR. Example: "10.12.0.0/24".Setting to empty/unset will disable HA. Setting to a valid subnet CIDR will create an HA gateway on the subnet.

properties.name: ha_gw_size
properties.description: (Optional) HA Gateway Size. Mandatory if HA is enabled (ha_subnet is set). Example: "t2.micro".

properties.name: enable_snat
properties.description: (Optional) Enable Source NAT for this container. Supported values: true, false. Default value: false.

properties.name: tag_list
properties.description: (Optional) Instance tag of cloud provider. Only supported for aws. Example: ["key1:value1","key002:value002"]

properties.name: enable_hybrid_connection
properties.description: (Optional) Sign of readiness for TGW connection. Only supported for aws. Example: false.

properties.name: enable_firenet_interfaces
properties.description: (Optional) Sign of readiness for FireNet connection. Valid values: true and false. Default: false.

properties.name: connected_transit
properties.description: (Optional) Specify Connected Transit status. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: insane_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Specify Insane Mode high performance gateway. Insane Mode gateway size must be at least c5 size. If enabled, will look for spare /26 segment to create a new subnet. Only available for AWS. Supported values: true, false.

properties.name: insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Transit Gateway. Required if insane_mode is enabled.

properties.name: ha_insane_mode_az
properties.description: (Optional) AZ of subnet being created for Insane Mode Transit HA Gateway. Required if insane_mode is enabled and ha_subnet is set.
The following arguments are deprecated:

properties.name: dns_server
properties.description: Specify the DNS IP, only required while using a custom private DNS for the VPC.

properties.name: vnet_name_resource_group
properties.description: (Optional) VPC-ID/VNet-Name of cloud provider. Required if for azure. ARM: "VNet_Name:Resource_Group_Name". It is replaced by "vpc_id".

NOTE: enable_firenet_interfaces - If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R1.8+, and a transit_vpc resource was originally created with a provider version < R1.8, you must do ‘terraform refresh’ to update and apply the attribute’s default value (false) into the state file.

NOTE: vnet_name_resource_group - If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R1.10+, and an ARM transit_vpc resource was originally created with a provider version < R1.10, you must replace "vnet_name_resource_group" with "vpc_id" in your configuration file, and do ‘terraform refresh’ to set its value to "vpc_id" and apply it into the state file.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Required) Name of Source gateway.

properties.name: nexthop
properties.description: (Required) Name of nexthop gateway.

properties.name: reachable_cidr
properties.description: (Required) Destination CIDR.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: gw_name1
properties.description: (Required) The first VPC Container name to make a peer pair.

properties.name: gw_name2
properties.description: (Required) The second VPC Container name to make a peer pair.

properties.name: enable_ha
properties.description: (Optional) Whether Peering HA is enabled. Valid values: true, false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: conn_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of for Transit GW to VGW connection connection which is going to be created. Example: "my-connection-vgw-to-tgw".

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the Transit Gateway. Example: "my-transit-gw".

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC-ID where the Transit Gateway is located. Example: AWS: "vpc-abcd1234".

properties.name: bgp_vgw_id
properties.description: (Required) Id of AWS's VGW that is used for this connection. Example: "vgw-abcd1234".

properties.name: bgp_vgw_account
properties.description: (Required) Account of AWS's VGW that is used for this connection. Example: "dev-account-1".

properties.name: bgp_vgw_region
properties.description: (Required) Region of AWS's VGW that is used for this connection. Example: "us-east-1".

properties.name: bgp_local_as_num
properties.description: (Required) BGP Local ASN (Autonomous System Number). Integer between 1-65535. Example: "65001".
The following arguments are deprecated:

properties.name: enable_advertise_transit_cidr
properties.description: (Optional) Switch to Enable/Disable advertise transit VPC network CIDR for a vgw connection.

properties.name: bgp_manual_spoke_advertise_cidrs
properties.description: (Optional) Intended CIDR list to advertise to VGW. Example: "10.2.0.0/16,10.4.0.0/16".

NOTE: enable_advertise_transit_cidr - If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R1.9+, and a vgw_conn resource was originally created with a provider version <R1.9, you must do ‘terraform refresh’ to update and apply the attribute’s default value (false) into the state file.

NOTE: enable_advertise_transit_cidr and bgp_manual_spoke_advertise_cidrs functionality has been migrated over to aviatrix_transit_gateway as of Aviatrix Terraform Provider R2.6. If you are using/upgraded to Aviatrix Terraform Provider R2.6+, and a vgw_conn resource was originally created with a provider version <R2.6, you must cut and paste these two arguments (and values) into the corresponding transit gateway resource referenced in this vgw_conn. A 'terraform refresh' will then successfully complete the migration and rectify the state file.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of cloud service provider, requires an integer value. Currently only AWS(1) is supported.

properties.name: account_name
properties.description: (Required) This parameter represents the name of a Cloud-Account in Aviatrix controller.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the vpc to be created.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) Region of cloud provider. Example: AWS: "us-east-1", ARM: "East US 2".

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: (Required) VPC cidr.

properties.name: aviatrix_transit_vpc
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether it is an Aviatrix Transit VPC. Valid values: true, false. Default: false.

properties.name: aviatrix_firenet_vpc
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether it is an Aviatrix Firenet VPC. Valid values: true, false. Default: false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Enter any name for the VPN profile.

properties.name: base_rule
properties.description: (Optional) Base policy rule of the profile to be added. Enter "allow_all" or "deny_all", based on whether you want a white list or black list.

properties.name: users
properties.description: (Optional) List of VPN users to attach to this profile.

properties.name: list description
action
properties.description: (Required) Should be the opposite of the base rule for correct behaviour. Valid values for action: "allow", "deny".

properties.name: proto
properties.description: (Required) Protocol to allow or deny. Valid values for protocol: "all", "tcp", "udp", "icmp", "sctp", "rdp", "dccp".

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) Port to be allowed or denied. Valid values for port: a single port or a range of port numbers e.g.: "25", "25:1024". For "all" and "icmp", port should only be "0:65535".

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) CIDR to be allowed or denied. Valid values for target: IPv4 CIDRs. Example: "10.30.0.0/16".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) VPC Id of Aviatrix VPN gateway. Example: "vpc-abcd1234".

properties.name: gw_name
properties.description: (Required) If ELB is enabled, this will be the name of the ELB, else it will be the name of the Aviatrix VPN gateway. Example: "gw1".

properties.name: user_name
properties.description: (Required) VPN user name. Example: "user".

properties.name: user_email
properties.description: (Optional) VPN User's email. Example: "abc@xyz.com".

properties.name: saml_endpoint
properties.description: (Optional) This is the name of the SAML endpoint to which the user is to be associated. This is required if adding user to a SAML gateway/LB.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: elb_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of ELB to be added to VPN User Accelerator. Example: "Aviatrix-vpc-abcd2134".
